caption.p: The medicinal uses of plants from genus Parkia.

tr.td: West coast of Africa and Nigeria
Bad cough, measles, and woman infertility
Wound healing leprosy, hypertension, mouth wash, toothpaste
Senegal, Mali, Ghana Togo, and South Africa
Decoction of the roots with Ximenia americana
Diarrhea, conjunctivitis, severe cough, and leprosy
Violent colic chest and muscular pain
Eaten raw or cooked oral decoction
Pounded with rice and applied on the neck
Decoction of bark and twig paste
Hair washing, skin diseases, and ulcers
Head washing, skin diseases, and ulcers
Decoction with Centella. asiatica and Ficus glomerata
Tender pod and bark taken orally
Diarrhea, dysentery, intestinal disorder, and bleeding piles
Green portion of the fruit mixed with water to be taken orally
Dysentery, diarrhea, food poisoning, wound, and scabies
Grounded and mixed with hot water
Postnatal care, diarrhea, edema and tonsillitis
Diabetes, hypertension, and urinary tract infections
Diarrhea, cholera dysentery, and food poisoning
